topics.definition: The act of going from one place to another, especially over a long distance.
topics.example: I love to travel and explore new countries.

topics.definition: The place to which someone is going or something is sent.
topics.example: Our destination was a beautiful beach resort.

topics.definition: A journey or excursion, especially for pleasure.
topics.example: We took a road trip across Europe last summer.

topics.definition: A period of time devoted to pleasure, rest, or relaxation.
topics.example: They went on a vacation to the mountains.

topics.definition: A person who travels for pleasure, often visiting famous places.
topics.example: The city attracts many tourists every year.

topics.definition: A document issued by a country to a citizen, permitting travel and identifying the holder.
topics.example: Make sure to bring your passport when traveling abroad.

topics.definition: A piece of paper that gives someone the right to enter a place or travel on a vehicle.
topics.example: She bought a plane ticket to Paris.

topics.definition: A place where airplanes take off and land, with facilities for passengers.
topics.example: We arrived at the airport two hours before our flight.

topics.definition: A place where people pay to stay when they are away from home.
topics.example: They booked a room at a luxurious hotel.

topics.definition: A car that you can rent for a short period of time.
topics.example: They picked up a rental car at the airport.

topics.definition: A form of transportation that runs on tracks.
topics.example: They took the train to the next city.

topics.definition: A large vehicle used for transporting passengers by road.
topics.example: She takes the bus to work every morning.

topics.definition: A car with a driver that you pay to take you somewhere.
topics.example: They hailed a taxi to take them to the museum.

topics.definition: A vacation spent traveling on a ship or boat.
topics.example: They went on a Caribbean cruise last winter.

topics.definition: Suitcases or other bags in which to pack personal belongings for traveling.
topics.example: She packed her luggage for the weekend trip.

topics.text: Mark and his family decided to go on a vacation to Europe. They booked their flights and arrived at the airport early to check in their luggage. After boarding the plane, they flew to their destination, a historic city known for its beautiful architecture. During their trip, they visited famous landmarks and enjoyed local cuisine. They traveled around the city by taxi and rented a car to explore nearby attractions. At the end of their vacation, they returned home with wonderful memories of their travels.

topics.definition: To begin a journey, especially by driving.
topics.example: They packed their bags and hit the road early in the morning.

topics.definition: To pack lightly and not bring too many things.
topics.example: She prefers to travel light with just a backpack.
